musicalLanguage.description: John Williams' magical theme from Harry Potter, originally scored for celesta to create its otherworldly sparkle. In 3/8 time, the theme has a lilting, music-box quality that perfectly captures the wonder of the wizarding world. The melody features the distinctive minor-key intervals and the characteristic triplet-like motion that makes it instantly recognizable.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: the celesta theme (4 bars), B section: the answer phrase with wider leaps (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: B to E — the opening call. Magic is happening.
Bar 3: The characteristic leap up to B4 — wonder and excitement.
Bars 5-8: The answering phrase with its wider, more adventurous intervals.
teachingGoals: 3/8 time — fast triple meter, one beat per bar
Minor key intervals that create a magical atmosphere
styleTips: Play like a celesta — light, sparkling, crystalline
Each bar should feel like one pulse, not three separate beats
The magic is in the lightness — never heavy or thumping

measures.teachingNote: Em — the famous opening. B up to E, then G. Magic begins.
B7 — just two notes in the right hand. F# pulls back to E.
Em — the opening figure returns. Same magic, building anticipation.
A — D falls to C#. The answering phrase begins differently.
C major — same melody, new harmony. The adventure deepens.
G — the high B5 to Bb5. Chromatic twist. Pure Williams magic.
F major — descending. The spell is winding down.
Em — single E5. The theme lands softly. Magic complete.
